14
15#ifndef ISC_TASKPOOL_H
16#define ISC_TASKPOOL_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file isc/taskpool.h
23 * \brief A task pool is a mechanism for sharing a small number of tasks
24 * among a large number of objects such that each object is
25 * assigned a unique task, but each task may be shared by several
26 * objects.
27 *
28 * Task pools are used to let objects that can exist in large
29 * numbers (e.g., zones) use tasks for synchronization without
30 * the memory overhead and unfair scheduling competition that
31 * could result from creating a separate task for each object.
32 */
33
34
35/***
36 *** Imports.
37 ***/
38
39#include <stdbool.h>
40
41#include <isc/lang.h>
42#include <isc/task.h>
43
44ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
45
46/*****
47 ***** Types.
48 *****/
49
50typedef struct isc_taskpool isc_taskpool_t;
51
52/*****
53 ***** Functions.
54 *****/
55
56isc_result_t
57isc_taskpool_create(isc_taskmgr_t *tmgr, isc_mem_t *mctx,
58 unsigned int ntasks, unsigned int quantum,
59 isc_taskpool_t **poolp);
60/*%<
61 * Create a task pool of "ntasks" tasks, each with quantum
62 * "quantum".
63 *
64 * Requires:
65 *
66 *\li 'tmgr' is a valid task manager.
67 *
68 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
69 *
70 *\li poolp != NULL && *poolp == NULL
71 *
72 * Ensures:
73 *
74 *\li On success, '*taskp' points to the new task pool.
75 *
76 * Returns:
77 *
78 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
79 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
80 *\li #ISC_R_UNEXPECTED
81 */
82
83void
84isc_taskpool_gettask(isc_taskpool_t *pool, isc_task_t **targetp);
85/*%<
86 * Attach to a task from the pool. Currently the next task is chosen
87 * from the pool at random. (This may be changed in the future to
88 * something that guaratees balance.)
89 */
90
91int
92isc_taskpool_size(isc_taskpool_t *pool);
93/*%<
94 * Returns the number of tasks in the task pool 'pool'.
95 */
96
97isc_result_t
98isc_taskpool_expand(isc_taskpool_t **sourcep, unsigned int size,
99 isc_taskpool_t **targetp);
100
101/*%<
102 * If 'size' is larger than the number of tasks in the pool pointed to by
103 * 'sourcep', then a new taskpool of size 'size' is allocated, the existing
104 * tasks from are moved into it, additional tasks are created to bring the
105 * total number up to 'size', and the resulting pool is attached to
106 * 'targetp'.
107 *
108 * If 'size' is less than or equal to the tasks in pool 'source', then
109 * 'sourcep' is attached to 'targetp' without any other action being taken.
110 *
111 * In either case, 'sourcep' is detached.
112 *
113 * Requires:
114 *
115 * \li 'sourcep' is not NULL and '*source' is not NULL
116 * \li 'targetp' is not NULL and '*source' is NULL
117 *
118 * Ensures:
119 *
120 * \li On success, '*targetp' points to a valid task pool.
121 * \li On success, '*sourcep' points to NULL.
122 *
123 * Returns:
124 *
125 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
126 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
127 */
128
129void
130isc_taskpool_destroy(isc_taskpool_t **poolp);
131/*%<
132 * Destroy a task pool. The tasks in the pool are detached but not
133 * shut down.
134 *
135 * Requires:
136 * \li '*poolp' is a valid task pool.
137 */
138
139void
140isc_taskpool_setprivilege(isc_taskpool_t *pool, bool priv);
141/*%<
142 * Set the privilege flag on all tasks in 'pool' to 'priv'. If 'priv' is
143 * true, then when the task manager is set into privileged mode, only
144 * tasks wihin this pool will be able to execute. (Note: It is important
145 * to turn the pool tasks' privilege back off before the last task finishes
146 * executing.)
147 *
148 * Requires:
149 * \li 'pool' is a valid task pool.
150 */
151
152ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
153
154#endif /* ISC_TASKPOOL_H */
155
